title: PSA to all the people saying SKT should let other teams win. this is a COMPETITION.
body: Only the best deserves to win.  The fact that you're asking a team to go "easy" on the other teams shows that you don't care about seeing good gameplay and only want your favorite teams to win.  If these other teams want to win, they need to step up their game.  Korea does NOT have to provide ANY handicap for the other regions.  If you really care about these other teams,  then instead of whining, invest your time and money into helping these teams become better.   /end rant

Also I've seen the game theory video before, and the problem I have with it is that he makes a lot weird equivalencies that don't actually get to the heart of why a sport is a sport. I mean, actors have to work out for their roles, they're competing against other actors for role selection in movies as well as the movies themselves competing. Guess that means movie acting is a sport too, right?

The thing that makes me sad is that this "esports" thing seems more an attempt to try and get video game tournaments branded under some other label (i.e. a sport), which actually delegitimizes video game tournaments as being worth attention - I mean, it doesn't need to be a sport to be competitive or require lots of skill, so why are they forcing this?

I'm not going to lie, I'm generally so dumbfounded and ecstatic that you share a different opinion than me but said so in an intelligent and polite manner without implying that me holding my opinion made me less of a person!

I actually see where you're coming from, the video itself is pretty shallow and I agree it makes a lot of stretches. I definitely hope more people look into the philosophy of what considers something to be a sport in the competitive sense and a sport as we know it nowadays and that video game tournaments have their own unique Place. Among the mainstream, but not in place of it is all I want. Then maybe we can see more (and better playing from the current) NA teams and such.

I have no reason to be rude to people who aren't rude to me first.

As for what is or isn't a sport, the most important thing is: are you moving your body?

Every sport from football to water polo to even golf require the players to move from one place to another. If you are sedentary, then you are not playing a sport.

Rather than solving the problem of competitive video games not getting recognition by branding them as "sports", I think the superior option is to push the value of video games as a medium in and of itself.
